'''Dunhir''' was the the brother of [[Baranor (video game character)|Baranor]] and the uncle of [[Eradan (video game character)|Eradan]]. Dunhir was invented by [[Electronic Arts]] for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]]''. Although he doesn't make an actual appearance in the game, he is mentioned in [http://www.warinthenorth.com/the-game/heroes/backstory#dunedainAnchor Eradan's History].<ref name="Backstory Eradan">{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.warinthenorth.com/the-game/heroes/backstory#dunedainAnchor|articlename=Human Character: Eradan's History|dated=|website=War in the North|accessed=25 December 2011}}</ref>

==History==
Dunhir's ancestors were members of a noble family from [[Númenor]], who were loyal to [[Elendil]]. After the [[Downfall of Númenor]] they went into exile to [[Middle-earth]] and served the [[Kings of Arnor|heirs of Elendil]] in [[Arnor]]. He was a [[Rangers of the North|Ranger]] and served [[Aragorn]]. After the death of [[Baranor (video game character)|Baranor]], he fostered Baranor's son, Eradan, and oversaw his training.<ref name="Backstory Eradan"/>
